jspecview.xml
Class SVGExporter

java.lang.Object
  jspecview.xml.SVGExporter

public class SVGExporter
extends java.lang.Object

class SVGExporter contains static methods to export a Graph as as SVG. SVGExporter uses Velocity to write to a template file called 'plot.vm'. So any changes in design should be done in this file.

Author:
Debbie-Ann Facey, Khari A. Bryan, Prof Robert J. Lancashire
See Also:
Graph

exportAsSVG

public static void exportAsSVG(java.io.Writer writer,
                               JSVPanel jsvp,
                               int specIndex,
                               boolean doZoom)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Exports the Graphs that are displayed by JSVPanel to a writer, with the same Color Scheme as the JSVPanel. If graph is zoomed then export the current view if doZoom is true

Parameters:
writer - the writer
jsvp - the JSVPanel
specIndex - the index of the graph to export
doZoom - if true the zoomed view is exported, otherwise full graph is exported
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportAsSVG

public static void exportAsSVG(java.lang.String fileName,
                               JSVPanel jsvp,
                               int specIndex,
                               boolean doZoom)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Exports the Graphs that are displayed by JSVPanel to a file given by fileName, with the same Color Scheme as the JSVPanel. If graph is zoomed then export the current view if doZoom is true

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file
jsvp - the JSVPanel
specIndex - the index of the graph to export
doZoom - if true then if graph is zoomed then export the current view
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportAsSVG

public static void exportAsSVG(java.io.Writer writer,
                               Coordinate[] xyCoords,
                               java.lang.String title,
                               int startDataPointIndex,
                               int endDataPointIndex,
                               java.lang.String xUnits,
                               java.lang.String yUnits,
                               boolean continuous,
                               boolean increasing,
                               java.awt.Color plotAreaColor,
                               java.awt.Color backgroundColor,
                               java.awt.Color plotColor,
                               java.awt.Color gridColor,
                               java.awt.Color titleColor,
                               java.awt.Color scaleColor,
                               java.awt.Color unitsColor)
Export a graph as SVG with specified Coordinates and Colors

Parameters:
writer - the Writer
xyCoords - an array of Coordinates
title - the title of the graph
startDataPointIndex - the start index of the coordinates
endDataPointIndex - the end index of the coordinates
xUnits - the units of the x axis
yUnits - the units of the y axis
continuous - true if the graph is continuous, otherwise false
increasing - true is the graph is increasing, otherwise false
plotAreaColor - the color of the plot area
backgroundColor - the color of the background
plotColor - the color of the plot
gridColor - the color of the grid
titleColor - the color of the title
scaleColor - the color of the scales
unitsColor - the color of the units

exportAsSVG

public static void exportAsSVG(java.io.Writer writer,
                               Coordinate[][] xyCoordsList,
                               java.lang.String title,
                               int[] startDataPointIndices,
                               int[] endDataPointIndices,
                               java.lang.String xUnits,
                               java.lang.String yUnits,
                               boolean continuous,
                               boolean increasing,
                               java.awt.Color plotAreaColor,
                               java.awt.Color backgroundColor,
                               java.awt.Color plotColor,
                               java.awt.Color gridColor,
                               java.awt.Color titleColor,
                               java.awt.Color scaleColor,
                               java.awt.Color unitsColor)
Export an overlayed graph as SVG with specified Coordinates and Colors

Parameters:
writer - the Writer
xyCoordsList - an array of arrays of Coordinates
title - the title of the graph
startDataPointIndices - the start indices of the coordinates
endDataPointIndices - the end indices of the coordinates
xUnits - the units of the x axis
yUnits - the units of the y axis
continuous - true if the graph is continuous, otherwise false
increasing - true is the graph is increasing, otherwise false
plotAreaColor - the color of the plot area
backgroundColor - the color of the background
plotColor - the color of the plot
gridColor - the color of the grid
titleColor - the color of the title
scaleColor - the color of the scales
unitsColor - the color of the units
